Cookies Policy
In this policy, unless it is obvious that they have some other meaning, the words "we", "our" and "us" refers to
www.seatalk.com
and its owner(s) Sea Talk Systems Ltd.
To contact the data protection officer you should email
[email protected]
.
This Cookie Policy outlines to you what “cookies” are, why they are used, how we use them and how you can disable them in your browser if desired. Please be aware that if you disable cookies in your browser there may be areas and aspects of our website which will not work as expected.
This cookie policy should be read alongside our
privacy policy
so you fully understand how and why we use cookies and the additional information we may collect from you. If you do not fully understand and agree with our cookie and privacy policies you must cease use of our website immediately.
If you require any clarification about our cookie policy please email the data protection officer.
Cookies – what are they?
Cookies are small text files which are stored on your computer’s hard drive. They can be used by websites to track the user, remember preferences, allow the user to login to secure areas of websites, store items in virtual shopping baskets and a whole host of other tasks.
Why and how do we use Cookies?
We use cookies to allow for a greater browsing experience for our users. As illustrated above, Cookies can perform a number of very useful tasks which allow this. We may also use Cookies to help us better understand our users, how they use our website and their preferences to further enhance our website and business.
The Cookies we may use tend to fit into three main categories. A list of the three categories follows, along with an explanation of how and why we use Cookies in each instance.
Analytical Cookies
We may use anonymous analytics Cookies to track the number of users we have, the pages they visit, the duration of the visit, and a whole host of other useful information about how our users browse and engage our website.
Knowing this information allows us to understand our audience reach, audience demographics, the success our marketing campaigns, which areas of our website are most popular, and clearer picture of how to design and implement new changes to our website and business going forward. We are not able to identify you as an individual using analytics Cookies.
Functionality Cookies
We may use Cookies as a method of storing information which allows you to browse and use our website efficiently.
We may use such Cookies to perform tasks such as storing the items you have added to your online shopping cart, the information you filled into a form, your credentials to keep you logged into a secure area of the website, and to remember various other preferences.
Cookies from third-parties
The Web is an integrated place. Like most other websites, we may have third-party applications, programs, widgets and material on our website. Some of these may use Cookies to track various metrics, store preferences and customise their material to you.
An example of this which is widely used across the Web is social media buttons which allow users to like, share and comment about what they find on websites and may result in Cookies being set.
We cannot view or change third-party cookies, in the same way third-parties cannot view or change cookies set by us.
Turning Cookies off in your browser
If you decide to turn Cookies off in your browser you should be aware that certain areas and features of our website may not work as expected.
The majority of mainstream, up-to-date browsers allow you to disabled Cookies. Usually you can find where to do this by going to the options or preference tab within your browser. We offer some links below which may help you:
Firefox:
Enable and disable cookies that websites use to track your preferences
.
Internet Explorer:
Block or allow cookies
.
Google Chrome:
Enable or disable cookies
.
For users worried about Cookies used by advertisers, you can learn much more about them and how to disable them by visit the
Your Online Choices
.
You can email the data protection officer if you require any further information about Cookies.

Sea Talk
海底産業への
接続技術

Sea Talk Systems は、UJ および UQJ キット、装置、ツールキットを UJ Consortiumメンバーに供給する独立認定サプライヤーです。
Sea Talk Systems は、海底ケーブル業界のキットおよびピースパーツの供給において数十年の経験を有する、密接に連携したチームメンバーで構成されるプロのチームです。
チームは100%信頼できるピースパーツ、キット、装置の重要性、そして膨大な故障コストを理解しています。これこそチームが故障リスクを排除するために厳格なプロセスを使用する理由であり、その実績はチーム全体の入念な作業の証となっています。
トレーニングはビジネスの中心に据えられており、STS はチームが最も正確な技術と最高の装置を使用していることを保証しています。チーム全員が複数のスキルを有し、この柔軟性により、注文を納期通りに納品する必要がある場合には、いつでもその業務に集中します。
経営陣はプロセスすべてを請け負う方法に関するトレーニングを受けています。このトレーニングにより、信頼性と効率性の両方において改善を行い、また潜在的なリスクを特定し、これを軽減するための識見を得ることができます。ビジネスのあらゆる局面をごく細部にいたるまで理解することは、100%の信頼性と納期通りの納品実績を維持する上で鍵となります。
品質管理
品質管理
UJ および UQJ キット
UJ および UQJ キット
お問い合わせ
お問い合わせ
STS は全数検査のビジネスモデルを使って事業を運営しています。これは事業を Cable & Wireless Marine から STS へ移管した際に引き継いだ慣行です。このビジネスモデルを維持することで、品質が非常に重要視される業界においてキットおよびピースパーツの品質と不良ゼロ確保が継続します。
この業界においては、システムダウンした場合、一つ故障が起きただけで、1日に何千万もの収益損となることがあります。もちろんトラフィックのリルーティングコスト、ケーブル敷設船の緊急レンタル、接続人員、評判や顧客信頼へのダメージは言うに及びません。
通常、システム故障の主な原因は漁船、船の錨、地震、津波、潮汐水です。STS は、修理や新しいキットが必要な場合、不良ゼロの目的に適合した製品やサービスを適時に供給することを保証することを誇りとしています。
STS は最新の装置やプロセス管理を用いて、最先端の専用施設で業務を行います。
Sea Talk の業務の概要をご説明したビデオをご覧ください
。

SEA TALK SYSTEMS ARE THE INDEPENDENT APPROVED SUPPLIER OF UJ AND UQJ KITS, EQUIPMENT AND TOOL KITS TO THE UJ CONSORTIUM MEMBERS
Sea Talk Systems are a close knit team of professionals, most with decades of experience in the supply of kits and piece parts for the submarine cable industry.
They understand the importance of 100% reliable piece parts, kits and equipment, as well as the enormous costs of failure. This is why they operate strict processes to eliminate the risk of failures, and their track record stands as testament to the careful work of the entire team.
Training is at the core of the business, STS make sure their team is using the most accurate techniques and the best equipment. All of their team are multi-skilled; this flexibility allows them to direct their efforts to wherever it is needed to fulfil their orders on time.
The management team are trained in how to undertake all of their processes. This gives them the insight to make improvements to both reliability and efficiency as well as spotting possible risks to mitigate. Understanding every aspect of the business in intimate detail is key to maintaining their track record of 100% reliability, delivered on time.
Quality Control
Quality Control
UJ & UQJ Kits
UJ & UQJ Kits
Contact
Contact
STS operate using a 100% inspection business model, which they inherited when the business was transferred from Cable & Wireless Marine to STS. Maintaining this business model continues to ensure quality and defect free kits and piece parts in this quality critical industry.
A single failure in this industry can result in the loss of hundreds of thousands in lost revenue per day if your system is down. Not to mention the cost of re-routing traffic, the emergency hire of cable ships, jointing personnel, damage to your reputation and customers’ confidence.
Typically the main reasons for system failures can be fishing boats, ship anchors, earthquakes, tsunamis and tidal waters. STS are proud to guarantee that when repairs, or new kits are necessary, they will be supplied on time with zero defects and fit for purpose.
STS operate from a state of the art, purpose built facility, using the latest equipment and process controls.

Quality Control Services
100% inspection of piece
parts, kits and equipment
SEA TALK SYSTEMS ARE THE INDEPENDENT APPROVED SUPPLIER OF UJ AND UQJ KITS, EQUIPMENT AND TOOL KITS TO THE UJ CONSORTIUM MEMBERS
S
ea
T
alk
S
ystems have a wealth of experience and proven track record for providing quality controlled kits to the UJ Consortium for over 28 years.
Sea Talk Systems business model is 100% inspection of piece parts, kits and equipment.
STS maintain a flexible approach to meeting all their customers’ requirements but will not compromise on quality. They focus on avoiding failure and its consequences.
Fast and accurate
Fast and accurate
Dimensional checking needs to be both fast and accurate. STS has invested in the latest co-ordinate measuring machines to maintain their confidence in the conformance of components to specification. All their inspection equipment is located in dedicated temperature controlled environments to aid in achieving these high standards.
Certified Quality
Certified Quality
STS holds
ISO 9001:2015 QUALITY CERTIFICATION
and also require their manufacturing subcontractors to maintain this accreditation as a minimum. Rigorous internal and external audits are carried out and continuously monitored and improved.
The established processes and practices at STS that have been developed within a business environment, demand a formal quality assurance regime and full traceability of activities, processes and materials.
Sourcing and procurement
Sourcing and procurement
Sea Talk’s role is to provide a sourcing and procurement facility to supply parts which range from small to high precision mechanical piece parts to equipment, at competitive costs and to the highest quality.
Every manufactured part, without exception, is subjected to a 100% inspection process, which includes dimensional checks, hardness tests, threads and finish, to drawing requirements. All mechanical equipment such as moulds and hydraulic presses are assembled and verified prior to despatch. Jointing equipment is fully assembled and checked prior to despatch.
Supplier management
Supplier management
A list of approved suppliers is maintained from information obtained from supplier questionnaires, historic data and delivery / quality performance. New suppliers are only added following successful audit assessment and prove out of manufacturing processes.
STS electronically store all inspection and manufacturing records to ensure there is full traceability of kits and piece parts for 25 years. In the event of system fault, without full traceability, it will be impossible to identify the root cause and take corrective action.

Sea Talk
Connecting Technologies
to the Subsea Industry
A proven track
record for delivery on
time with zero defects
SEA TALK SYSTEMS ARE THE INDEPENDENT APPROVED SUPPLIER OF UJ AND UQJ KITS, EQUIPMENT AND TOOL KITS TO THE UJ CONSORTIUM MEMBERS
Sea Talk Systems are a close knit team of professionals, most with decades of experience in the supply of kits and piece parts for the submarine cable industry.
They understand the importance of 100% reliable piece parts, kits and equipment, as well as the enormous costs of failure. This is why they operate strict processes to eliminate the risk of failures, and their track record stands as testament to the careful work of the entire team.
Training is at the core of the business, STS make sure their team is using the most accurate techniques and the best equipment. All of their team are multi-skilled; this flexibility allows them to direct their efforts to wherever it is needed to fulfil their orders on time.
The management team are trained in how to undertake all of their processes. This gives them the insight to make improvements to both reliability and efficiency as well as spotting possible risks to mitigate. Understanding every aspect of the business in intimate detail is key to maintaining their track record of 100% reliability, delivered on time.
Quality Control
Quality Control
UJ & UQJ Kits
UJ & UQJ Kits
Contact
Contact
STS operate using a 100% inspection business model, which they inherited when the business was transferred from Cable & Wireless Marine to STS. Maintaining this business model continues to ensure quality and defect free kits and piece parts in this quality critical industry.
A single failure in this industry can result in the loss of hundreds of thousands in lost revenue per day if your system is down. Not to mention the cost of re-routing traffic, the emergency hire of cable ships, jointing personnel, damage to your reputation and customers’ confidence.
Typically the main reasons for system failures can be fishing boats, ship anchors, earthquakes, tsunamis and tidal waters. STS are proud to guarantee that when repairs, or new kits are necessary, they will be supplied on time with zero defects and fit for purpose.
STS operate from a state of the art, purpose built facility, using the latest equipment and process controls.
Please watch their video
for a summarised view of Sea Talk’s operations.

Our Processes
SEA TALK SYSTEMS ARE THE INDEPENDENT APPROVED SUPPLIER OF UJ AND UQJ KITS, EQUIPMENT AND TOOL KITS TO THE UJ CONSORTIUM MEMBERS
Sea Talk Systems run all operations using a bespoke Process Control Plan with the end goal in mind. Their system guarantees that STS start right to finish right and provide their Customers with quality products on time with zero defects.
STS work in partnership with individual UJ Consortium Members by holding an agreed level of complete kits for call off when required.
Due to Sea Talk's close working relationship with it’s UJ Consortium Members, STS can offer a rapid turnaround on kits and piece parts to support emergency requirements.
Each kit is uniquely serialised to ensure full traceability from top level to each individual part within the kit. Each kit is given a double and independent check to ensure that all kits are supplied with zero defects.
